question.question-text: .............is an application that is designed to work on different operating systems.
.............is a Staroffice function.
.............is used to create text document
.............is used to create a spread shee
....... is used to create a presentation
.............is used to create a spread sheet
.............is used to create a database
.............is used to draw
.............is a word processor
A ............. may contain text, labels, graphs, charts, equations, pictures and drawings,
.............is an example of commercially available word processing packages.
.............is the default name of a file which you created using staroffice writer,
............. always indicates where new text will appear
............. should be pressed only at the end of the paragraph or when a blank line is to be inserted,
To select a drive in save as dialog box to be clicked.
............. is the short cut key to do the save action.
............. is the command to close the file.
............. menu is used to switch over between documents.
By clicking the buttons visible on the ............., we can switch over between documents.
The thick horizontal line in the page area is called the
To move the insertion point with the mouse, the mouse pointer is moved to the required spot and the mouse button is .............
To move the insertion point one character to the left ............. key is used.
To move the insertion point one character to the right ............. key is used.
To move the insertion point one word to the left ..........key is used.
To move the insertion point one word to the right ............. key is used.
To move the insertion point one cell to the left ............. key is used.
To move the insertion point one cell to the right ............. key is used.
To move the insertion point one line up...........key is used.
To move the insertion point one line down ............. key is used.
To move the insertion point to the end of a line ............. key is used.
To move the insertion point to the beginning of a line ............. key is used.
To move the insertion point to the end of the document ............. key is used.
To move the insertion point to the beginning of the document ............. key is used.
To scroll the screen one page up ............. key is used.
To scroll the screen one page down.............key is used.
If the document is long the text can be scrolled through without moving the .............
If there are several pages in the document the user can know the page number by looking at the pop-up page number that appears next to the .............
In a document there are ............. sets of scroll arrows one for up and down movement.
............. key deletes the characters to the left of the insertion point.
............. key deletes the characters to the right of the insertion point.
The user in the ........... mode, if the text existing to the right of the insertion disappears, while typing a new text,
The user can toggle between type-over mode and the insert mode by using the ............. key.
............. gives the information about the current mode(insert or type-over mode)
The ............. mouse button should be clicked, held down and dragged across the text to be selected.
To unselect the wrongly selected text a ............. should be made outside the selected text.
The ............. key is pressed down and the movement keys are used to highlight the required text.
To select a word ............. click is to be made.
............. key is used to select the entire document.
............. set of keys can be used to move a text.
............. set of keys can be used to copy a text.
In the............. box, type the text that you want to find your document.
In the ........... box, enter the replacement word or phrase.
To skip the current occurrence of a word found ............. to be pressed.
To replace the current occurrence of a word found ............. to be pressed.
To replace all the occurrence of a word found ............. to be pressed.
A text without any special formatting can have a ........... appearance.
Bold, italic or ........... are the most common types of text formatting.
Bold, italic or underlined option can be selected by activating the ........... option in the character dialog box.
........... is the short cut key for activating bold.
........... is the short cut key for activating italic.
........... is the short cut key for activating underline.
........... fonts look professional and are suited for business document.
........... fonts are decorative.
........... fonts look like symbols.
........... of the font is measured in points.
There are ........... points to an inch.
Documents will be printed as shades of gray on a ........... printer.
........... can be used to call attention to key ideas or pointers in a document
When reading something important in a book, a magazine, a report, or any document, the reader takes a ........... highlighter pen and drag across it.
To remove the highlighting , select the text and select the ........... from the colour palette.
A hard return is inserted every time when ......... is pressed.
The paragraphs in a document is ........... line spaced, by default.
When typing in star office writer, all text is ........... aligned, and the right margin is ragged or uneven.
There are alignments of paragraph in a document.
The text in a paragraphs can be ........... to keep both the margins even.
........... is the shortcut key to align the text in left.
.......... is the shortcut key to align the text in right.
........... is the shortcut key to align the text in center.
........... is the shortcut key to align the text in justify option.
..... is a special kind of indent, for numbered list.
By pressing the increase indent thrice, the text will move ........... inches from left.
One wants to undo the indent, the ..... icon is to be clicked.
For the purpose of indenting, if we use the paragraph dialogbox should be used to make increase indent.
For the purpose of indenting, if we use the paragraph dialogbox ........... should be used to make decrease indent.
A ........... value will result in a hanging indent.
........ number of line spacing options available in the star office writer.
One way to set off a list of points or topics in a document is to create a ........
Various styles of bullets and numbering can be selected by using ........... menu.
Star Office writer includes a dictionary and ...........
StarOffice writer can identify the ..... mistakes.
When feature is ON, star office writer compares each word typed with the words in the dictionary.
The misspelled word is underlined by squiggly ..... line.
If the right spelling is not known, staroffice writer can help with some choices by clicking word by clicking.
........... key is to be pressed to activate the spelling command after the document is typed
............ text area displays the misspelled word in the spelling check dialog box.
........... list displays any alternative spellings in the spelling check dialog box.
........... button is, clicked to add the word to the dictionary.
AutoCorrect Dialog box can be opened by activating the menu ...........
Spelling check dialog box can be opened by activating the menu ..........
Star Office writer displays the ...... as a grid with specified number of rows and columns.
Insert table dialog box can be opened by selecting the menu ..... >
Floating tool bar for inserting function has the INSERT TABLE icon in the ........... place.
Once the table is created, StarOffice Writer places in the insertion point in the ......... cell of the table.
.......... is the intersection of a column and a row.
.......... key is used to move forward through cells.
.......... key is used to move backward through cells.
If the entry in a cell is long, it automatically increases ........
The simplest way to add a row is to press ........... in the last row of the table.
To insert more than one row in a table ...... to be clicked.
By pressing the tab key in the last row of the table rows to be inserted.
By pressing the delete key after selecting the table, it will erase ..........
To resize a column, place the cursor in a table cell, hold down ...... and then press the left or right arrow.
To resize the column without changing the width of the table, hold down and then press the left or right arrows.
To resize a row, place the cursor in a table cell, hold down ..... and then press the up or down arrow.
To make all column even, ........... dick inside the table and select column space equally in the pop-up menu.
To make all rows even, ...... click inside the table and select rows space equally in the pop-up menu.
.......... lcon is used to combine two or more cell into a single cell.
........... icon is used to split a cell into two or more cells.
........... icon is used to insert a row below the current row.
........... icon is used to insert a column after the current column.
........... icon is used to deletes the current row from the table.
........... icon is used to deletes the current column from the table.
icon displays a floating toolbar with different border option for the table.
........... icon is used to choose the style of line to be used for the border.
........... icon displays a palette of colours that can be used as a border colour of the table,
dialog can be used to set the width of the column to an exact size.
........... tool bar is used to change the borders of the table.
Every table should be identified by a specific .......!
